meanings.definition: To cause (something) to happen or begin
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside was instigating my dog to bark.
meanings.sent2: She was instigating a dance party by playing upbeat music.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was instigating the cat to chase it around the yard.
meanings.sent4: His contagious laughter was instigating joy in everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies was instigating cravings in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To urge, provoke, or incite (someone) to do something
meanings.sent1: The coach was instigating the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker was instigating the audience to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student was instigating his classmates to play a prank on the teacher.
meanings.sent4: Her inspiring story was instigating hope in those who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop was instigating a sense of awe in the hikers.
